Posts.Content: May 31, 2019 07:08PM movingsoccermom wrote: Hello Ladies. Joining you with recently found recurrent and metastatic cancer. Multiple chest lymph nodes and a "cluster of small opacities" in my left lung. Starting Ibrance soon, with debate over a second drug. I just want the coughing to stop. All the best
Posts.Title: mets to lung bhd1 movingsoccermom
Would you mind sharing your age at time of diagnosis? ByFaith Gussy

Posts.Content: Apr 18, 2015 11:39AM - edited Apr 18, 2015 11:40AM by movingsoccermom I can relate to genetic challeges. I am the oldest of 5 siblings; 4 of us have been diagnosed with cancer. 6/7 of my Aunts have been diagnosed with either breast/ovarian/uterine cancer. My Dad died of colon cancer. You see my diagnosis below. I am grateful to be stage 1, but certainly have had my down days since the initial phone call. Hang in there, read as much as you can, and make the best choices for you.
Posts.Title: Just feeling down today... Cmo65 movingsoccermom

Posts.Content: Apr 25, 2017 08:26PM movingsoccermom wrote: To everyone who posted here with your descriptions, thank you so very much. I have not been formally diagnosed, but after shoveling exceptionally heavy spring snow, my armpit felt like there was half an orange in it, and my pinkie and ring fingers started tingling. I had no idea what was going on, or why my armpit was so painful, to the point that I could not sleep on the non surgical side because I could not put down my surgical arm. Your many descriptions were very helpful and pushed me to get an appointment to evaluate what was going on. Thank you again!
